It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1846 Feb. 19, Nashville [to] Adam Fergusson, Carthage, Tenn[essee] / John S Dashiell
bibl.author: Dashiell, John S.
bibl.note: This document is a letter dated February 19, 1846, to Adam Fergusson from John S. Dashiell. Dashiell, Grand Secretary of the Masonic Grand Lodge of Tennessee, requests that Fergusson call an action to vote on the new constitution submitted by the Grand Lodge at their next local meeting.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: At the next regular Meeting of your Lodge you Will please cause an action to be had on the New Constitution submitted by the Grand Lodge at its last Annual Meeting to the Subordinate Lodges for their approval or rejection it is all important that this should be attended to at as early a day as possible, if a sufficient number should adopt it the Grand Master Will issue his Circular to that Effect that the same may be for the government of the Lodges. you will please address your Letter to me, as soon as you have taken action as aforesaid
